data.title: Turkey part ways with Fatih Terim after 'brawl' incident
data.meta_description: Turkey national soccer team coach Fatih Terim has left his job two weeks after he was involved in a brawl in a west coast holiday.
data.text:
ByEurosport

Updated 26/07/2017 at 13:55 GMT

Turkey national soccer team coach Fatih Terim has left his job two weeks after he was involved in a brawl in a west coast holiday town, the Turkish Football Federation (TFF) said in a statement on Wednesday.

Euro 2016: Fatih Terim - Turkey manager

Image credit: Reuters

The 63-year-old former Fiorentina, AC Milan and Galatasaray boss, was seen in television footage fighting with a restaurant owner. Turkish media said he and his sons-in-law left five men injured after the incident.

"Some non-football issues have been wearing out our football director Fatih Terim and the management of Turkish football federation," TFF said on Wednesday.

"The two sides agreed that it would be more healthy for both parties to part ways," it added.
